arlut.csd.ganymede.common
Class Query

java.lang.Object
  arlut.csd.ganymede.common.Query
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The Query class is used to submit query requests to the GANYMEDE server, both for complex database searches and for simple object listings. A Query class can fully specify a boolean search expression on any field of any object type in the GANYMEDE database. Each Query, however, can only search one object type at a time. While providing support for arbitrarily complex queries, the Query class also includes constructors for the simple "list object" case.

See Also:
Serialized Form

serialVersionUID

static final long serialVersionUID
See Also:
Constant Field Values

objectType

public short objectType
The id of the object type that the queryNodes are looking to match on. If this value is left at -1, objectName will be consulted instead.

objectName

public java.lang.String objectName
The name of the object type that the queryNodes are looking to match on. This value is consulted only if objectType is left at -1.

saveName

public java.lang.String saveName
We want to be able to save a query on the server and re-issue it on behalf of the user. If we are saved, the name to save under will be here. We may or may not want it here. I don't believe anything in the server actually uses this yet.

root

public QueryNode root
The root of a graph of QueryNodes that encodes the desired search criteria.

editableOnly

public boolean editableOnly
If true, this query will only be matched against objects in the database that the user has permission to edit.

filtered

public boolean filtered
If true, this query will only be matched against the subset of objects in the database that the user has requested via the Session filter mechanism.

permitSet

private java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> permitSet
A Set of field id's in Short form that the server will take into account when returning a data dump. If null, all default fields should be returned.

Query

public Query(short objectType,
             QueryNode root,
             boolean editableOnly)
Constructor for fully specified query (base by id)

Parameters:
objectType - numeric object type code to search over
root - root node of a boolean logic tree to be processed in an in-order traversal
editableOnly - if true, the server will only return objects that the user's session currently has permission to edit

Method Detail

setFiltered

public void setFiltered(boolean filtered)
This method determines whether the query engine will filter the query according to the current list of visible owner groups. Queries by default are filtered.

Parameters:
filtered - If true, the query will be masked by ownership
See Also:
Session.filterQueries(java.util.Vector)

resetPermitSet

public void resetPermitSet()
This method resets the permitSet, allowing all fields to be returned by default.

hasPermitSet

public boolean hasPermitSet()
This method returns true if this Query is requesting a restricted set of fields.

addField

public void addField(short id)
This method adds a field identifier to the list of fields that may be returned. Once this method is called with a field identifier, the query will only return fields that have been explicitly added. resetPermitSet() may be called to reset the list to the initial allow-all state.

removeField

public void removeField(short id)
This method adds a field identifier to the list of fields that may be returned. Once this method is called with a field identifier, the query will only return fields that have been explicitly added. resetPermitSet() may be called to reset the list to the initial allow-all state.

returnField

public boolean returnField(short id)
This method returns true if the field with the given id number should be returned.

returnField

public boolean returnField(java.lang.Short value)
This method returns true if the field with the given id number should be returned.

getFieldSet

public java.util.Set<java.lang.Short> getFieldSet()
Returns a copy of the restricted list of fields that this Query wants to have returned.
